official-title.#text:
To authorize pedestrian and motorized
		  vehicular access in Cape Hatteras National Seashore Recreational Area, and for
		  other purposes.

short-title.#text:
Preserving Access to Cape Hatteras
			 National Seashore Recreational Area Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (hereafter in this Act referred to as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Preserving Access to Cape Hatteras National Seashore Recreational Area Act/s:3

quote.#tail:
) issues a new final rule that meets the requirements
			 set forth in

text.#text:
After the date of the enactment of this
			 Act, Cape Hatteras National Seashore Recreational Area shall be managed in
			 accordance with the Interim Protected Species Management Strategy/Environmental
			 Assessment issued by the National Park Service on June 13, 2007, for the Cape
			 Hatteras National Seashore Recreational Area, North Carolina, unless the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not impose any
			 additional restrictions on pedestrian or motorized vehicular access to any
			 portion of Cape Hatteras National Seashore Recreational Area for species
			 protection beyond those in the Interim Management Strategy, other than as
			 specifically authorized pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Preserving Access to Cape Hatteras National Seashore Recreational Area Act/s:3

header.#text:
Additional
			 restrictions on access to Cape Hatteras National Seashore Recreational Area for
			 species protection

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines that
			 additional restrictions on access to a portion of the Cape Hatteras National
			 Seashore Recreational Area are necessary to protect species listed as
			 endangered under the

may only restrict, by limitation, closure, buffer, or otherwise,
			 pedestrian and motorized vehicular access for recreational activities for the
			 shortest possible time and on the smallest possible portions of the Cape
			 Hatteras National Seashore Recreational Area.

text.#text:
If, based on
			 peer-reviewed science and after public comment, the

Restrictions
			 imposed under this section for protection of species listed as endangered under
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not be
			 greater than the restrictions in effect for that species at any other National
			 Seashore.

shall designate pedestrian and vehicular
			 corridors of minimal distance on the beach or interdunal area around closures
			 implemented under this section to allow access to areas not closed.

text.#text:
To the maximum
			 extent possible, the

header.#text:
Inapplicability
			 of final rule and consent degree

quote.#tail:
(77 Fed. Reg. 3123–3144)
			 shall have no force or effect after the date of the enactment of this
			 Act.
quote.#text:
Special Regulations, Areas of the National Park System, Cape Hatteras
			 National Seashore—Off-Road Vehicle Management

text.#text:
The April 30, 2008, consent decree filed in the United
			 States District Court for the Eastern District of North Carolina regarding
			 off-road vehicle use at Cape Hatteras National Seashore in North Carolina shall
			 not apply after the date of the enactment of this Act.
